Unfortunately, because of social distancing guidelines and operational changes due to the COVID-19 virus, the Library will be unable to host the High School Internship in Summer 2021.

Get paid $500 and experience first-hand everything that really goes on in a University Library!

Applications are due by March 1, 2020. One reference from guidance counselor or teacher required.

The University of Virginia Library high school student internship program provides high school students with the opportunity to explore the wide array of career opportunities in libraries. The internships aim to attract students from populations traditionally underrepresented in librarianship. To that end, minorities and males are encouraged to apply.

We catalog books and help patrons with reference questions, of course, but we also do 3-D printing, build websites and databases, digitize and preserve materials, maintain extensive archives of rare resources, teach classes in everything from research methods to GIS, support media creation, and much, much more…

Please return the completed application to your guidance counselor by March 1, 2020. Your guidance counselor should submit this application and one reference to libraryhsinternship@virginia.edu.

Internship details

  •   Reference letters can be about things like your work ethic in classes, maybe volunteer work or leadership roles you’ve done, challenges you’ve faced and overcome, or what makes you stand out and why you’d be a good fit to intern at the UVA Library.
  •   Finalists will be asked to participate in a short Skype or Google Talk interview with the search committee.
  •   All applicants will be notified about their application status by May 1. Parent/guardian of selected interns will be contacted after May 1, 2020.
  •   The dates of the internship are June 9-17, 2020. Each day will run from 8:30am-5pm and you must be able to attend each full day.
  •   The internship will pay $500.
  •   Selected interns will be given information about the Library departments offering internships and your preference for placement will be strongly considered.
  •   The University Library is committed to providing a welcoming environment for all regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual preference, sexual identity, age, or disability.  
  •  

  Come experience library work in a way you’ve never imagined! Did we mention it pays $500?

  Questions? Contact Ashley Hosbach at libraryhsinternship@virginia.edu.
